value.title: Star schema or single table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Is it better to build a model as a regular star schema or as a single table in Power BI? The answer is clear: a star schema is always the best choice. This video analyzes the performance differences of the two approaches. Article and download: https://sql.bi/704257?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/qEWrYO1ioe0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using ALLEXCEPT vs ALL VALUES
value.excerpt: ALLEXCEPT is a handy DAX function to retrieve all the columns of a table except for some. When used as a CALCULATE modifier, its behavior is less intuitive and might result in inaccurate measures. In this video, we elaborate on the most common mistake when using ALLEXCEPT in CALCULATE. Article and download:

value.title: Using KEEPFILTERS in DAX
value.excerpt: This video explains how to use KEEPFILTERS to intersect instead of overriding an existing filter context in DAX. Using FEEPFILTERS simplifies the code and improves performance. Article and download: https://sql.bi/751682?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive

value.title: Data analysis in Power BI
value.excerpt: Report authors can use additional features to enhance their reports for analytical insights in their data with features like Q&A and exporting. In this module, you will closely examine your data and Power BI reports and then extract value with deeper analysis. Additionally, you will learn how to sort data and how to present the report in a cohesive manner. You will learn how to get a statistical summary for your data and export data from Power BI. You will also apply and perform advanced analytics on the report for deeper and more meaningful data insights.

topItems.title: Perform analytics in Power BIÂ
topItems.excerpt: You will learn how to use Power BI to perform data analytical functions, how to identify outliers in your data, how to group data together, and how to bin data for analysis. You will also learn how to perform time series analysis. Finally, you will work with advanced analytic features of Power BI, such as Quick Insights, AI Insights, and the Analyze feature.

topItems.title: Work with AI visuals in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: This module describes the AI capabilities of Power BI.

value.title: Introduction to data analytics on Azure
value.excerpt: Introduction to data analytics on Azure

topItems.title: Explore Azure data services for modern analytics
topItems.excerpt: Understand analytics solutions in the Azure data ecosystem. Explore the architecture of a scalable analytics solution to meet business needs.

topItems.title: Understand concepts of data analytics
topItems.excerpt: Explore key concepts of data analytics, including types of analytics, data, and storage. Explore the analytics process and tools used to discover insights.

topItems.title: Explore data analytics at scale
topItems.excerpt: Describe data analytics at scale and understand the roles of a data team. Learn about the responsibilities of an enterprise data analyst and what tools are available to build scalable solutions.

value.title: Work with AI visuals in Power BI
value.excerpt: This module describes the AI capabilities of Power BI.

value.title: CreateÂ paginated reportsÂ Â
value.excerpt: Paginated reports allow report developers to create Power BI artifacts that have tightly controlled rendering requirements. Paginated reports are ideal for creating sales invoices, receipts, purchase orders, and tabular data. This module will teach you how to create reports, add parameters, and work with tables and charts in paginated reports.

value.title: Describe Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the Power BI Desktop model structure, star schema design basics, analytics queries, and report visual configuration. This module provides a strong foundation on which you can learn to optimize model designs and add model calculations.

value.title: Explore Azure data services for modern analytics
value.excerpt: Understand analytics solutions in the Azure data ecosystem. Explore the architecture of a scalable analytics solution to meet business needs.

value.title: Explore data analytics at scale
value.excerpt: Describe data analytics at scale and understand the roles of a data team. Learn about the responsibilities of an enterprise data analyst and what tools are available to build scalable solutions.

value.title: Explore what Power BI can do for you
value.excerpt: As a consumer, you'll work in the Power BI service to review and interact with content that has been shared with you. This module provides the foundational information that you need to work effectively in the Power BI service.

value.title: Introduction to modern analytics using Excel and Power BI
value.excerpt: This module introduces the Microsoft modern analytics core suite of tools, including Office 365/Excel 2016+, Power Query, Data Model, Power BI Desktop, and Power BI service. By using modern analytics technologies, you and your organization can work faster, more efficiently, and smarter by using Excel together with Power BI.

value.title: Structure analytical report designs in Power BI
value.excerpt: Designing an analytical report involves understanding the requirements and its audience. However, designing a compelling analytical report requires understanding the automatic and unconscious processes that occur when report consumers comprehend what they see. When you have the knowledge of how to structure and apply report design principles, you can raise the level of your report designs to produce relevant, intuitive, and visually pleasing experiences for your report consumers.

value.title: Price Prediction with Python and Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to create a machine learning price prediction using Python machine learning linear regression model and a dataset of 54,000 diamonds. This will be ported over to Power BI for a deeper level of interaction.  You can find the files and dataset here: https://github.com/Gaelim/Diamond-Price-Prediction
